Article.ArticleTitle: A Self-Formed Stable PbI<sub>2</sub> /NiO<sub>x</sub> Interface with Increased Ni<sup>3+</sup> Centers for Perovskite Photovoltaics.

AbstractText: Nickel oxide (NiO<sub>x</sub> ) is a promising hole transport material (HTM) for perovskite photovoltaics owing to its chemical stability and low cost. However, most NiO<sub>x</sub> based solar cells deliver relatively weak performance because of its insufficient electrical property and interfacial contact. In this work, a self-formed PbI<sub>2</sub> /NiO<sub>x</sub> interface was developed to stabilize the Ni<sup>3+</sup> centers, which was beneficial for electrical transport and band alignment in perovskite solar cells. Combined with ultraviolet ozone treatment (UVO) and sequential deposition, the density of Ni<sup>3+</sup> centers was greatly increased and could be stabilized by the PbI<sub>2</sub> interface. These merits contributed coordinately to the fast hole extraction and low energy loss across the PbI<sub>2</sub> /NiO<sub>x</sub> interface, yielding power conversion efficiencies (PCEs) of over 19 %.
